wikipedia_page.main: Reginald Archibald Cammell (10 January 1886 – 17 September 1911) was an early British military aviator and the first to be killed on active service.

response: * 17 September – British aviator Reginald Archibald Cammell of the newly-formed Air Battalion Royal Engineers is the first military pilot to die on active service in the UK
* Reginald Archibald Cammell, military aviation pioneer and the first pilot to die on active service.

link_mentions.page: List of accidents and incidents involving military aircraft before 1925
response: :Lieutenant Reginald Archibald Cammell of the British Air Battalion was killed at Hendon while conducting a trial flight of an ASL Valkyrie Type B  with his own engine fitted.  The accident was not considered to be due to faults in the aircraft, but to have been caused by Cammell's lack of experience with the aircraft.The Passing of Lieut R.A. Cammell, R.E. Flight magazine, 23 September 1911
*Reginald Archibald Cammell (1886-1911), first British military aviator to die on active service

link_mentions.page: List of pilots awarded an Aviator's Certificate by the Royal Aero Club in 1911
response: | style="background: #e3d9ff;" | Lt. Reginald Archibald Cammell, RE

Four aircraft were given to the War Office to promote military aviation in Britain."Valkyries and the Government" Flight, 8 July 1911, p,593. One of these crashed at Hendon on 17 September 1911 when on a trial flight after a new engine had been fitted: the pilot, Lieutenant Reginald Archibald Cammell was killed.The Passing of Lieut R.A. Cammell, R.E. Flight, 23 September 1911, p.830 The accident was not considered to be due to faults in the aircraft, but to have been caused by Cammell's lack of experience with the aircraft.
